greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least number k>0 such that k^n does not divide the denominator of generalized harmonic number H(k,n) nor the denominator of alternating generalized harmonic number H'(k,n).
comment: Generalized harmonic numbers are defined as H(n,k) = Sum[ 1/i^k, {i,1,n} ]. Alternating generalized harmonic numbers are defined as H'(n,k) = Sum[ (-1)^(i+1)*1/i^k, {i,1,n} ].

Some apparent periodicity in a(n) (not without exclusions): a(n) = 20 for n = 2 + 4m, a(n) = 42 for n = 4 + 12m and 8 + 12m, a(n) = 76 for n = 9 + 18m, a(n) = 77 for n = 1 + 10m, a(n) = 104 for n = 7 + 12m, a(n) = 110 for n = 12m, a(n) = 136 for n = 25 + 32m, etc.
See more details in comments for A128672 and A125581.
link: Max Alekseyev, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..158.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Harmonic Number
results.author: _Alexander Adamchuk_, Mar 24 2007
